intro: Polygala balduini var. carteri, commonly known as the Carter's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which is characterized by its distinctive, often intricate floral structures. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, featuring slender stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with a unique morphology that includes a spurred petal, typical of the genus Polygala. This species is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
